intro: Psychotria farmarii, commonly known as the Caribbean Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean islands, particularly Cuba and Hispaniola, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It is often found in shaded understories of tropical forests, growing as an epiphyte or terrestrial plant. Psychotria farmarii is also noted for its role in local ecosystems and its potential ethnobotanical uses.
